p: Srilekha Sridhara et al. reported a rare case of silicone pneumonitis with pneumothorax occurred even after 15–20 years of silicone injection 12. Bronchoscopic lung biopsy demonstrated alveolar interstitium with numerous lipoid vacuoles, compatible with silicone deposition. The patient succumbed despite treated with intravenous corticosteroids, broad‐spectrum antibiotics, and mechanical ventilation.
